alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 15 at 5:06PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 705 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 705 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 505 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen since 300 PM. Thunderstorms will move northeast at 40 MPH. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moreno Valley, Oceanside, Carlsbad, Temecula, Vista, Encinitas, southern Lake Elsinore, Poway, Ramona and Valley Center. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
